title: What are orbitals and subshells? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question let start to understand what is subshell according to me subshell is like a house of orbital an orbital is a region in the atom where the probability of finding electron is maximum and according to Schrodinger every electron has the wave function and now question is rising what is wave function wave function is a function which satisfy the wave equation

For the first shell, not much, because it only has one orbital (). But the second subshell comprises four different orbitals (in one basis, ), the third has nine (one , three , five ), the fourth has sixteen (), and so on.
